alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:30PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR TALBOT...QUEEN ANNE`S...CAROLINE AND SOUTHWESTERN KENT COUNTIES... At 529 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Overton to near Kent Point to near Marlton, moving east at 40 mph. This line of storms has a history of producing wind damage across the DC metro. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 528 PM EDT, a 59 mph wind gust was reported on Poplar Island. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Easton, Centerville, Talbot, Denton, Centreville, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Rock Hall, Trappe, St. Michaels, Church Hill, Preston, Oxford, Goldsboro, Queen Anne, Smithville, Old Town, Grasonville and Starr. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
